meanings.definition: A person who warns or reprimands someone firmly.
meanings.sent1: The admonishers scolded the child for running into the street.
meanings.sent2: The teacher acted as one of the admonishers, reminding the students to complete their homework.
meanings.sent3: The admonishers at the library kindly reminded patrons to keep their voices down.
meanings.sent4: The strict coach was like an army of admonishers, pushing the team to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The admonishers' words echoed in the student's mind, urging them to improve their behavior.

meanings.definition: Those who give advice or caution to others.
meanings.sent1: The group of experienced hikers were seen as the wise admonishers on the trail.
meanings.sent2: Family members can often be the best admonishers when it comes to making important decisions.
meanings.sent3: The admonishers in the office always had helpful tips for staying organized.
meanings.sent4: The elderly couple were like gentle admonishers, guiding the young couple through their first home purchase.
meanings.sent5: The admonishers' guidance was like a beacon of light in the midst of confusion for the new employees.
